The ASAS system. I saw the video... DO WANT. It both helps stabilize attitude very smoothly and conservatively on fuel, and allows manuel attitude adjustments while activated. I wouldnt say I was disppointed about anything in the next patch because it sounds a heck of a lot better than the last one which did nothing for my gameplay at all pretty much. At least this one improves the SAS a lot which is badly needed.

I echo one of the comments above though that I would love to see more enhancements prelaunch - steam, smoke, moving gantries, Kerbals/vehicles, countdowns when you press the launch button, etc stuff that enhances the whole launch sequence and makes it more of an event.

The only other thing I am waiting for other than resources is better aerodynamics so that tall rockets are more sensible than wide ones and better drag etc so re-usable planes can glide back properly to a landing (this would also require more accurate landing information - flightpath marker or whatever on the screen - so you can re-enter and land properly on a runway).

All of these things affect a great deal of the game's gameplay, and that I think is what is needed now - sweeping changes to the gameplay not just tinkering. Each patch now should have something meaningful to add to the game as a whole otherwise its not worth releasing.

Edited July 1, 2013 by nats

Making ASAS 'smarter' is the most important improvement I've wanted. I hope it finally knows how to handle gimbaled engines well (so they don't bang back and forth to maximum deflection, and so clustered engines can control roll). A part to add control torque to go along with this would be very nice.

Disappointed about resources? No, I was disappointed about that back in 0.19...now I'm kind of resigned to it.

I'm not disappointed with anything in 0.21. In fact, I'd rather see Squad getting the core systems down THEN building on them than releasing a massive amount of content which would probably be harder to bugfix when the inevitable occurs.

* Revised Flight-End scene flow: Hooray! No more accidentally deleting 40 hours of space station

* Player Progress Tracking System: Sounds good. I can't wait to see what Squad to with this. Perhaps the disappointment here is that it will only be the framework and perhaps one or two things. In other words, the disappointment is having to wait for the future

* Overhauled Space Center Scenery: I don't really see the point in this, but aesthetics are always nice. I hope it doesn't drop performance at KSC, although basically anything does on my current machine

* The Astronaut Complex Facility: Description brings to mind the Tavern in all versions of HoM&M Those annoying not-so-great Kerbals can now stay in the space center where they belong!

* Crew Management: I want to assign a Kerbal to a cubic octagonal strut. Sounds a lot like Crew Manifest, so I'm all for this.

* Overhauled Space Center Facilities: See scenery

* More Upgrades to Parts and Part Modules: More save-breaking changes, but at least the changes made so far have been for the better

Summary: My only disappointment is my own impatience for updates. Keep up the good work Squad!
